ResMed's innovation-driven success and prospects
data.description:
ResMed Inc., founded in 1989 and headquartered in San Diego, California, is a global leader in digital health and medical devices with origins in Australia. The company specializes in technologies for sleep apnea, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), and other respiratory conditions, offering cloud-connected devices and AI-powered software to enhance home healthcare.

ResMed operates in over 140 countries and its platforms, such as myAir and AirView, support millions of users and clinicians, emphasizing innovation and data-driven care. Net sales are divided among medical devices (51.8%), masks (35.7%), and software as a service (12.5%). As of June 2025, ResMed had eight production sites in the U.S., Australia, China, Singapore, Malaysia, and France. Revenue distribution: U.S., Canada, & Latin America (58%), Europe, Asia, & Other (30%), and RCS (12%).

Innovative AirTouch N30i mask

ResMed Inc. has cemented its reputation for innovation in medical technology by winning two prestigious 2025 Red Dot Design Awards for its AirTouch N30i nasal cradle mask, recognized in both the Innovative Products and Medical Design & Healthcare categories. The AirTouch N30i, launched in October 2024, introduces ResMed's first-ever nasal cushion made from fabric fused with silicone for enhanced comfort, breathability, and therapy adherence.

In clinical studies, users rated the mask a perfect 10 out of 10 for comfort features. ResMed now boasts a global portfolio of 10,000 patents and designs, underscoring its leadership in sleep and respiratory care technology.

Improved cash flow

ResMed reported strong performance over FY 22-25, with a revenue CAGR of 12.9%, reaching 5.2 billion US dollars in FY 25, driven by robust demand for its sleep and respiratory devices and strong unit sales of masks and accessories. EBIT rose at a CAGR of 19.0% to USD 1.7bn, with margins expanding from 28.0% to 32.8%, aided by favorable product mix.

FCF rose significantly from USD 131m to USD 1.2bn over FY 22-25. This improvement was aided by cash from operations which rose from USD 351m to USD 1.8bn. In addition, cash and cash equivalent increased from USD 274m to USD 1.2bn. Total debt decreased from USD 918m to USD 852m. This led to improved gearing from 27.3% to 14.3%.

Moreover, in Q1 26, revenue and income from operations saw significant growth, with revenue increasing notably. Gross margin improved substantially, with strong EPS and CFO. Non-GAAP metrics also showed impressive gains.

In comparison, Edwards Lifesciences Corporation, a local peer, reported a revenue CAGR of 1.3% over FY 21-24, reaching USD 5.4bn in FY 24. However, EBIT declined at a CAGR of minus 2.3% to USD 1.5bn, with margins expanding from 30.3% in FY 21 to 27.2% in FY 24.

Optimistic analyst views

Over the past 12 months, the company's stock has delivered modest returns of approximately 3.8%. In comparison, Edwards Lifesciences' stock delivered higher returns of around 21.6% over the same period.

ResMed is currently trading at a P/E of 24.0x, based on the FY 26 estimated EPS of USD 10.5, which is lower than its 3-year historical average of 30.2x and Edwards Lifesciences' P/E of 35.2x. The company is currently trading at EV/EBIT multiple of 17.6x, based on FY 26 estimated EBIT of USD 2.0bn, which is lower than its 3-year historical average of 22.5x and Edwards Lifesciences (28.0x).

ResMed is monitored by the 18 analysts, with 11 having 'Buy' ratings and seven having 'Hold' ratings for an average target price of USD 295.8, implying 17.3% upside potential over the current market price.

Consensus estimates a revenue CAGR of 7.7%, reaching USD 6.4bn over FY 25-28. EBIT is estimated to rise at a CAGR of 10.3% to USD 2.4bn with margins expanding by 250bp to 36.8%. Net profit estimated at a CAGR of 9.9% to USD 1.9bn, while EPS is expected to increase to USD 12.8 in FY 28 from USD 9.5 in FY 25. Analysts estimate an EBIT CAGR of 10.8% but net profit to decline at a CAGR of minus 25.2% for Insulet Corporation.

Overall, ResMed demonstrates strong growth and innovation, solidifying its leadership in digital health and medical devices. Despite facing competitive pressures and market risks, its robust financial performance, impressive product portfolio, and optimistic analyst outlook suggest a promising future. Continued investment in technology and strategic management will be crucial for maintaining its market position.

However, ResMed faces risks including market normalization, supply chain challenges, and rising costs. Its narrow competitive moat requires ongoing innovation investment. Potential downturns in healthcare spending or regulatory changes could impact its strong market position and growth trajectory.

Maruti Suzuki India second quarter profit misses estimates
data.description:
(Reuters) -Maruti Suzuki, India's largest carmaker, reported second-quarter profit below estimates on Friday as higher input costs and expenses weighed on margins.

The 'Brezza' SUV manufacturer's standalone profit rose 7.3% to 32.9 billion indian rupees ($374.31 million) in July-September, falling short of analysts' expectations of 35.93 billion rupees, according to data compiled by LSEG.

($1 = 87.8950 Indian rupees)

(Reporting by Chandini Monnappa, Kashish Tandon and Meenakshi Maidas in Bengaluru)

DENSO Corporation Announces Dividend for the Second Quarter-End of the Year Ending March 31, 2026, Payable on November 26, 2025
data.description: DENSO Corporation announced dividend of JPY 32.00 per share for the second quarter-end of the year ending March 31, 2026 against JPY 32.00 per share a year ago. Scheduled date of commencement of dividend payment is November 26, 2025.

data.title: DENSO Corporation Revises Consolidated Earnings Guidance for the Fiscal Year Ending March 31, 2026
data.description: DENSO Corporation revised consolidated earnings guidance for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2026. For the year, the company revises revenue of JPY 7,240,000 million, Operating profit of JPY 651,000 million, Profit for the year of JPY 548,000 million, and Basic earnings per share of JPY 180.52 compared to revenue of JPY 7,200,000 million, Operating profit of JPY 675,000 million, Profit for the year of JPY 569,000 million and Basic earnings per share of JPY 193.67 previous guidance. The full-year forecast for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2026, due to reflecting financial results in the second quarter including the quality provisions, and reassessment of foreign exchange assumptions, the Company revises revenue, operating profit, profit before income taxes, profit for the year and profit attributable to owners of the parent company.

India's ACC profit jumps on cement price rebound, volumes beat; shares up
data.description:
(Reuters) -Indian cement producer ACC reported a second-quarter profit jump on Friday, as prices rebounded on-year and volumes came in higher than expected in a seasonally weak period.

Pre-tax profit was 7.57 billion rupees ($86.1 million) for July-September, more than double from last year. The company received a tax write-back of 6.71 billion rupees in the reported quarter.

Meanwhile, revenue rose 28% to 58.17 billion rupees, helped by a 16% rise in volumes. Data from at least five brokerages showed that the expected growth was between 4% and 14%.

Shares of the company rose 2% after results.

For further earnings highlights, click here.

KEY CONTEXT

Adani Group-owned ACC, Ambuja Cements and larger rival UltraTech Cement have managed to shield their volumes from seasonal volatility, thanks to the string of deals inked in the sector recently, analysts said.

The quarter coincides with India's annual monsoon season, during which construction takes a hit and demand for cement sags, pressuring volumes and prices.

While cement prices were little changed sequentially, they were 5% higher from last year, Ambit Research data showed. During most of 2024, cement prices corrected from previous year's highs amid a drought of new projects exacerbated by India's general elections.

Analysts expect cement demand to recover in the second half of fiscal year 2026, as tax-cuts-spurred demand boost trickles in.

data.title: Wheels India Sept-quarter consol net profit 309.9 million rupees
Mozambique Considering TotalEnergies' Request to Increase LNG Project Costs, Bloomberg Says
data.description:
--Mozambique's President Daniel Chapo said his government is considering a proposal by France's TotalEnergies to alter the contract period and approve increased costs for its liquefied natural gas project, Bloomberg reports.

--The French energy major is seeking a 10-year extension to the project--which has been delayed since 2021 due to security issues but is close to restarting--as well as a $4.5-billion increase in costs, according to Bloomberg.

--"Mozambique may present counterarguments, and then we can reach a consensus on whether the proposed extension will proceed or not," Chapo said in translated comments, Bloomberg reports.


Full story: https://shorturl.at/hNU8q


Write to Adam Whittaker at adam.whittaker@wsj.com


(END) Dow Jones Newswires

10-31-25 0433ET

data.title: Chinese official touts country as 'ideal' investment, urges unity at APEC summit
data.description:
BEIJING (Reuters) -China's Commerce Minister Wang Wentao on Thursday touted the country as an "ideal and safe" investment destination and urged nations to resist unilateral bullying.

Wang, delivering a speech on behalf of Chinese President Xi Jinping at an Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit event in South Korea, said the world was standing at a new crossroads, between choosing unity or returning to hegemony.

"We must strengthen unity and collaboration, oppose protectionism, resist unilateral bullying, and avoid the world from reverting to the law of the jungle," Wang said.

(Reporting by Ju-min Park and Beijing Newsroom; Editing by Christian Schmollinger)
